meanings.definition: The process of passing an electric current through a substance to cause a chemical change.
meanings.sent1: During the electrolyses, the electricity transformed the liquid.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study electrolyses to understand how chemicals react to electricity.
meanings.sent3: The classroom erupted in giggles when the teacher accidentally caused a mini electrolyses experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the power to create an emotional electrolyses within him.
meanings.sent5: The electrolyses in the lab created a colorful display of reactions.

meanings.definition: The decomposition of a substance by an electric current.
meanings.sent1: The electrolyses of water produces hydrogen and oxygen gases.
meanings.sent2: The electrolyses of saltwater separates the sodium and chlorine ions.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen mishap resulted in an unintentional electrolyses of the ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The electrolyses of the metal revealed its components in a surprising way.
meanings.sent5: The electrolyses of the solution unveiled hidden properties of the substance.

meanings.sent1: She electrolyses the metal to study its reaction to electricity.
meanings.sent2: The scientist electrolyses the compound to observe its behavior under current.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly electrolyses his food to see if it changes its taste.
meanings.sent4: The artist electrolyses the paint to create unique patterns.
meanings.sent5: They electrolyses the solution to investigate its properties further.
